snippet: New guidelines from the C.D.C. could help curb the alarming increase in prescription drug deaths, but more needs to be done.
abstract: Editorial praises Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's new recommendations on prescribing opioid painkillers; argues stricter guidelines, which though voluntary should still influence doctors and state lawmakers, will help slow opioid overdose epidemic; calls on government to increase funding for addiction treatment.
lead_paragraph: New guidelines from the C.D.C. could help curb the alarming increase in prescription drug deaths, but more needs to be done.
